## function_getKeyName
> **getKeyName**(`event`): `string`

### Parameters

• **event**: [`KeyboardEvent`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent)

keyboard event

### Returns

`string`

the name of the key, including modifiers

## function_isInternalInputNavigation
> **isInternalInputNavigation**(`event`): `boolean`

### Parameters

• **event**: [`KeyboardEvent`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/KeyboardEvent)

keyboard event

### Returns

`boolean`

true if the keyboard event is an ArrowLeft, ArrowRight, Home or End key press that should make the cursor move inside
the input and false otherwise.

## interface_NavManagerItemConfig
Type of the parameter of the navigation manager directive.

### Type Parameters

• **T** = `any`

### Properties

#### context?

> `optional` **context**: `T`

***

#### keys?

> `optional` **keys**: [`Record`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/utility-types.html#recordkeys-type)\<`string`, [`NavManagerKeyHandler`](#navmanagerkeyhandler)\<`T`\>\>

Map of key handlers.
The key in the map should match the result of calling [getKeyName](#getkeyname) on the key event (for example "ArrowLeft" or "Ctrl+PageDown").
The value in the map is the corresponding key handler.

***

#### selector()?

> `optional` **selector**: (`directiveElement`) => [`Iterable`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/iterators-and-generators.html#iterable-interface)\<[`HTMLElement`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement)\>

Function returning DOM elements to include in the navigation manager.
It receives as a parameter the DOM element on which the navigation manager directive is used.
If not specified, the default selector function only returns the element on which the navigation manager directive is used.

##### Parameters

• **directiveElement**: [`HTMLElement`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement)

##### Returns

[`Iterable`](https://www.typescriptlang.org/docs/handbook/iterators-and-generators.html#iterable-interface)\<[`HTMLElement`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement)\>

## type alias_NavManagerKeyHandler
> **NavManagerKeyHandler**\<`T`\>: (`info`) => `void`

Type of a key handler of the navigation manager.
A key handler receives an object as its parameter, with the following properties:
- event: key event
- directiveElement: DOM element which has the navigation manager directive
- navManager: navigation manager instance

### Type Parameters

• **T** = `any`

### Parameters

• **info**

• **info.context?**: `T`

• **info.directiveElement**: [`HTMLElement`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/HTMLElement)

• **info.event**: [`Event`](https://developer.mozilla.org/docs/Web/API/Event)

• **info.navManager**: [`NavManager`](#navmanager)

### Returns

`void`
